alert.note: Alert for Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 10:47PM EST until February 28 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Stillwater Creek At Uhrichsville affecting Tuscarawas County. Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County. .Previous and forecast rainfall will keep both Stillwater Creek at Uhrichsville and the Muskingum River at Coshocton above flood stage through the weekend.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC157-241715- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0017.000000T0000Z-220228T0600Z/ /URVO1.1.ER.220223T1516Z.220226T1800Z.220228T0000Z.NO/ 1047 PM EST Wed Feb 23 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillwater Creek at Uhrichsville. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillwater Creek comes out of its banks in several locations resulting in overflowing in poor drainage areas. Minor flooding of low lying areas begins. At 11.5 feet, Flood waters of Stillwater Creek will reach the intersection of East 12th Street and North Main Street in Uhrichsville and approach Newport Street. Little Stillwater Creek will flood most of Phac Park along with portions of Wilson Road in Dennison. At 12.9 feet, Numerous low land areas are flooded. Stillwater Creek begins to flood portions of Newport Street in Uhrichsville. Homes along Park Drive begin to flood. Sections of Wilson Road near Phac Park are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 10.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall to 10.2 feet and begin rising again Friday morning. It will rise to 11.2 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
